intro: Agrostemma githago subsp. thessalum, commonly known as the Thessalian cornflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and slender, branched stems. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This subspecies is considered a minor weed but has ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
